node.excerpt:
It has been nearly nine months since we originally  announced  that
AdoptOpenJDK is moving to the Eclipse Foundation, and changing our name…

frontmatter.author: tsc
frontmatter.title: Transition to Eclipse - An Update
frontmatter.description: An update on our transition from AdoptOpenJDK to Eclipse Adoptium.

node.excerpt: AdoptOpenJDK is happy to announce the immediate availability of AdoptOpenJDK 8u282, 11.0.10, and 15.0.2. Binaries are available for download…

frontmatter.author: andreasahlenstorf
frontmatter.title: AdoptOpenJDK 8u282, 11.0.10, and 15.0.2 Available
frontmatter.description: AdoptOpenJDK is happy to announce the immediate availability of AdoptOpenJDK 8u282, 11.0.10, and 15.0.2. Binaries are available for download of OpenJDK and Eclipse OpenJ9 (with OpenJDK class libraries). As always, all binaries are thoroughly tested and available free of charge without usage restrictions on a wide range of platforms.

node.excerpt: Back in the day when everybody got their JDK from Sun and later Oracle it included an  assortment of fonts  that could be used in addition…

frontmatter.author: andreasahlenstorf
frontmatter.title: Prerequisites for Font Support in AdoptOpenJDK
frontmatter.description: Proper font support in AdoptOpenJDK requires some additional configuration on Linux and Solaris. Without it, you get unhelpful NullPointerExceptions.

node.excerpt: Six months ago,  we announced  that AdoptOpenJDK is going to join the  Eclipse Foundation  and rebrand as  Eclipse Adoptium . After a long…

frontmatter.author: tsc
frontmatter.title: Eclipse Adoptium Projects Ready for Community Review
frontmatter.description: Community Review is the last step before we can officially start Eclipse Adoptium. It gives all of you an opportunity to ask questions, suggest improvements, or raise concerns. We also have an update to our transition roadmap.

node.excerpt: AdoptOpenJDK and Alibaba are happy to announce we have joined forces to build, test, and distribute  Dragonwell JDK  on AdoptOpenJDK's…

frontmatter.author: tsc
frontmatter.title: AdoptOpenJDK Welcomes Dragonwell
frontmatter.description: With Alibaba Dragonwell, another flavour of OpenJDK is being built at and distributed by AdoptOpenJDK. Dragonwell is a TCK-certified implementation of Java for large-scale application deployments on Alibaba Cloud and elsewhere.
